00060 /*===========================================================================
00061  *      Description :   Process C argc. argv
00062  *==========================================================================*/
00063 /* 10/29/02 REK Adding config.h */
00064 #include <config.h>
00065 #include <library/c_basic.h>
00066 #include <library/c_arg.h>
00067 
00068 int
00069 C_get_arg (int argc, char **argv, C_Arg arg[], int n)
00070 {
00071   int i, num;
00072   char *word;
00073   /*
00074    *  Reset the argument structure.
00075    */
00076   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00077     arg[i].option = 0;
00078   /*
00079    *  Find the starting location of option lists.
00080    */
00081   num = 0;
00082   for (i = 0; i < argc; i++)
00083     {
00084       word = argv[i];
00085       if (word[0] == '-')
00086         {                       /* create a new option descriptor */
00087           num++;
00088           if (num >= n)
00089             C_assert (0, "C_get_arg: too many options");
00090           arg[num - 1].option = C_savestr (word);
00091           arg[num - 1].spec = argv + (i + 1);
00092           arg[num - 1].count = 0;
00093         }
00094       else
00095         {
00096           arg[num - 1].count += 1;
00097         }
00098     }
00099   return num;
00100 }
